Can be zero to have the pool act as a normal pool instead of a proxy."}},"setRemotePool(uint64,bytes)":{"params":{"remoteChainSelector":"The remote chain selector for which the remote pool address is being set.","remotePoolAddress":"The address of the remote pool."}},"setRouter(address)":{"params":{"newRouter":"The new Router"}}},"stateVariables":{"s_previousPool":{"details":"The previous pool, if there is any. This is a property to make the older 1.0-1.4 pools compatible with the current 1.5 pool. To achieve this, we set the previous pool address to the currently deployed legacy pool. Then we configure this new pool as onRamp and offRamp on the legacy pools. In the case of a 1.4 pool, this new pool contract has to be set to the Router as well, as it validates who can call it through the router calls. This contract will always return itself as the only allowed ramp.Can be address(0), this would indicate that this pool is operating as a normal pool as opposed to a proxy pool."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"acceptOwnership()":{"notice":"Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient."},"applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[])":{"notice":"Apply updates to the allow list."},"applyChainUpdates((uint64,bool,bytes,bytes,(bool,uint128,uint128),(bool,uint128,uint128))[])":{"notice":"Sets the permissions for a list of chains selectors. params.chains: A list of chains and their new permission status & rate limits. Rate limits are only used when the chain is being added through `allowed` being true.

returns._0: true is enabled, false if not.

getRemotePool(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

getRemoteToken(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

params.remoteChainSelector: The selector of the remote chain.

returns._0: true if the given chain is a permissioned remote chain.
true if the token is supported by the pool.

params.lockOrBurnIn: Encoded data fields for the processing of tokens on the source chain.

returns.lockOrBurnOut: Encoded data fields for the processing of tokens on the destination chain.

params.releaseOrMintIn: All data required to release or mint tokens.

returns._0: releaseOrMintOut The amount of tokens released or minted on the local chain, denominated in the local token's decimals.

params.inboundConfig: The new inbound rate limiter config, meaning the offRamp rate limits for the given chain.
params.outboundConfig: The new outbound rate limiter config, meaning the onRamp rate limits for the given chain.
params.remoteChainSelector: The remote chain selector for which the rate limits apply.

params.prevPool: The address of the previous pool. Can be zero to have the pool act as a normal pool instead of a proxy.

params.remoteChainSelector: The remote chain selector for which the remote pool address is being set.
params.remotePoolAddress: The address of the remote pool.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[.notice: Apply updates to the allow list.

applyChainUpdates((uint64,bool,bytes,byt.notice: Sets the permissions for a list of chains selectors. Actual senders for these chains need to be allowed on the Router to interact with this pool.

getAllowListEnabled().notice: Gets whether the allowList functionality is enabled.

getCurrentInboundRateLimiterState(uint64.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getCurrentOutboundRateLimiterState(uint6.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getOnRamp(uint64).notice: Legacy fallback for the 1.4 token pools.

getRemotePool(uint64).notice: Gets the pool address on the remote chain.

getRemoteToken(uint64).notice: Gets the token address on the remote chain.

getToken().notice: Gets the IERC20 token that this pool can lock or burn.

isOffRamp(uint64,address).notice: Return true if the given offRamp is a configured offRamp for the given source chain.

isSupportedChain(uint64).notice: Checks whether a remote chain is supported in the token pool.

isSupportedToken(address).notice: Returns if the token pool supports the given token.

lockOrBurn((bytes,uint64,address,uint256.notice: Lock tokens into the pool or burn the tokens.

releaseOrMint((bytes,uint64,address,uint.notice: Releases or mints tokens to the receiver address.

setChainRateLimiterConfig(uint64,(bool,u.notice: Sets the chain rate limiter config.

setPreviousPool(address).notice: Configures the legacy fallback option. If the previous pool is set, this pool will act as a proxy for the legacy pool.

setRemotePool(uint64,bytes).notice: Sets the remote pool address for a given chain selector.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Signals which version of the pool interface is supported

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

documentation.text:
@dev The previous pool, if there is any. This is a property to make the older 1.0-1.4 pools
 compatible with the current 1.5 pool. To achieve this, we set the previous pool address to the
 currently deployed legacy pool. Then we configure this new pool as onRamp and offRamp on the legacy pools.
 In the case of a 1.4 pool, this new pool contract has to be set to the Router as well, as it validates
 who can call it through the router calls. This contract will always return itself as the only allowed ramp.
 @dev Can be address(0), this would indicate that this pool is operating as a normal pool as opposed to
 a proxy pool.
@notice Legacy fallback for the 1.4 token pools.
@notice Return true if the given offRamp is a configured offRamp for the given source chain.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,bytes memory,uint256,uint64,bytes memory) external returns (bytes memory)
